Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: from top, black band above pomegranate frieze; in tondo, part of undetermined black-figure decoration with some added red (paper label glued on sherd covers almost entire surface); exterior: part of horizontal handle palmette with added red core.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.6)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 278, no. 182)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 555, no. E23)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. 23)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240, no. 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.08) (Phase 1)
